intro: Linkia microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited linkia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. Linkia microcarpa is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
